definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: I only honoured my promise to your father.
sentences.chinese: 我只不過完成了我對你父親的承諾。

sentences.english: His father works at the weather station.
After lunch my father dozes in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 喫過午飯後我父親總在他的椅子上打個盹。

sentences.english: Duggan, a father of four, died of a single gunshot wound to the chest, an inquest at north London Coroner's Court heard on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 驗屍報告稱，這位四歲小孩的父親被槍擊中胸腔致死。
連父親都深深地被打動。

sentences.english: She was rejected by her father and his second wife. Zora was forced to take care of herself.
sentences.chinese: 她父親和繼母不養她，卓拉被迫自己照顧自己。

sentences.english: Hi, Mandy. Is your father in?
sentences.chinese: 你好，曼蒂。你父親在家嗎？

sentences.english: My father was the presiding judge in a case involving a man charged with tax evasion.
sentences.chinese: 我父親是一宗一男子逃稅案的主法官。

sentences.english: My father is too old to do any work now.
sentences.chinese: 我父親現在太老，幹不動什麼活了。

sentences.english: My father is a worker in a clothing factory.
sentences.chinese: 我父親是一間衣廠的一位員工。

sentences.english: To tell you the truth , your father was right when he said that you undersold the company.
sentences.chinese: 老實告訴你，你父親對你低價拋售公司的判斷是對的。

sentences.english: My father always picks me up after school.
sentences.chinese: 我父親常開車順便接我。

sentences.english: She was found shacking up with three of the guys by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她被她父親發現跟三個男孩過夜了。

sentences.english: I said; `that's your father's tale, too, I suppose.'
sentences.chinese: 我說，“我猜那也是你父親編出來的故事。”

sentences.english: My father was a man of few words.
sentences.chinese: 我父親是個少言寡語的人。

sentences.english: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
sentences.chinese: 4示劍對他父親哈抹說，求你爲我聘這女子爲妻。

definition: Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
